comment: Hayes will not sugar coat A&P, but he is an awesome teacher. Up front with what you will be tested on, and pretty funny too. One complaint, I was always intimidated when asking questions b/c he seemed like he wished he was somewhere else/thought I was stupid. Study DAILY for this class, no matter what prof you have. Lab is much harder than lecture.
This guy is the best. Seriously, he is funny, helpful, and tells you everything that is going to be on the test. I would definitely recommend taking him for A&P Lab.
Mr. Hayes is wonderful. Definitely the best option for AP lab at KSU! Very nice and helpful. Take him if you can!

Professor Hayes is a great teacher. I highly recommend him. He makes a difficult subject as comprehendible as possible and is very helpful if you have questions. He maintains a good balance between being strict (which you especially have to be with A&P!) and approachable/nice. Take him if you get the chance!

I took him for A&P 1 lab. I am taking him for A&P 2 lecture next semester. Very helpful when you have questions. He is a bit sarcastic which I find funny. Lets you know what you must know for the practical. He gives assignments in masteringA&P to help you earn more points so the practical isn't your total points. Very good teacher, take him!
He is very helpful, Even during the practical if you have questions or confusion he clarifies them and help you out. And posts grades right away.

I had him for A&P 2 lecture and it was not bad at all. We dealt with a horrible schedule because of the snowpocalypse but other than that, the class was very fair. Dr. Hayes has awesome ways of explaining difficult physiology. 100% take him over the other professors, it's worth taking an 8 am.
Awesome teacher! He was very helpful and always told us exactly what we needed to know for the exam. He was also very open to questions. Making an A in his lab is very possible!

A&P lab is hard. It is a lot of work. Professor Hayes does not and will not baby you. That being said, he is a really nice guy and willing to help with any questions you may have in lab. He is quick to post grades and updates on D2L. I would take him if his class is open.
